channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for AZ
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for AZ

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Drum was found leaking and was placed into a hazmat bag and taken to QA to be processed. DescribePack: The lid on top was discovered loose. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Drum was placed into a white pail into the hazmat cage waiting for disposition.

item.title: Report X-2023080764

Report X-2023080764

  • City: PHOENIX
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Drum was found leaking at the 414-loading door where it was placed into a hazmat bag and taken to QA to be processed. DescribePack: Drum contain a puncture hole on top near the lid. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Drum was placed into a white pail where it is in the hazmat processing cage waiting for disposition.

item.title: Report E-2023080925
item.description:
Report E-2023080925

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-05T15:12:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-16
  • City: PHOENIX
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On August 16, 2023, two (2) 2.5-gallon jugs of sodium hydroxide were punctured by a forklift and released approximately one and a half (1.5) gallons of product to the dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from GrayMar Environmental Services (GES) to remediate the site. GES personnel removed the damaged containers and wiped the area with absorbent pads. All sodium hydroxide-impacted material was containerized in two (2) 55-gallon drums for disposal.

item.title: Report E-2023080769
item.description:
Report E-2023080769

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-02T06:14:17+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-08
  • City: PHOENIX
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On August 8, 2023, fourteen (14) 25-kilogram bags of UN3261 were damaged during transit and released approximately one hundred (100) pounds of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Graymar Environmental Services (GES) to remediate the impacted surface. GES personnel removed the damaged bags and secured them in two (2) 55-gallon drums. The crew utilized hand tools to contain the released material in one (1) 15-gallon drum for disposal.

item.title: Report X-2023081085
item.description:
Report X-2023081085

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-02
  • City: PHOENIX
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package arrived at QA leaking due to a dented content without outer packaging. We placed the package in a hazmat bag then in a yellow drum. DescribePack: Package is a metal pail filled with liquid with no other type of outer packaging causing it to get damage and leak easily. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: We placed the package in a hazmat bag then in a yellow drum.

  • Description: During off loading the warehouse crew accidentally put a forklift fork into one of the metal 55 gallon drum of polycat 12 (un2922) releasing 1 gallon of product. Contractors were dispatched for the containment and cleanup of the release.
